quote.quotepara: Use single quotes and double back-slashes. PHP strings also have escape sequences that use the back-slash as escape character, that's why you have to double them. And single quotes to avoid the $ character interpreted as the start of a variable.
PS: Will we be risking going the perl way if we ask that PHP supported regular expressions natively (I mean: without having to provide them as strings)?
